cafes.name: El Meson
cafes.comments: Best cappuccino and croissant I've ever had. Place is rather small, so working there when it's empty is awkward.

cafes.name: Oromo Cafe
cafes.comments: Nice little coffee shop in the heart of Lincoln Square. Not much food here.

cafes.name: Satellite Cafe
cafes.comments: Tiny, small menu, mediocre coffee. Sister location Maiden Voyage is good.

cafes.name: Everybody's Coffee
cafes.comments: Good place to get work done. Busy enough and big enough. Coffee is fine.

cafes.name: Two Hearted Queen
cafes.comments: I'm giving this place threes all around because I don't remember anything about it.

cafes.name: Metropolis Cafe
cafes.comments: Metropolis brand coffee is the pride of Chicago, apparently. I hate it. This place takes Wi-Fi away after like an hour, as well. So in addition to not having enjoyable coffee, it's not a good place to work. The ambiance is otherwise nice, but it's always overly crowded. Mexican hot cocoa is good.

cafes.name: Zanzibar
cafes.comments: This place is always weird. I just avoid it.

cafes.name: Ipsento
cafes.comments: Really great spicy latte. Nice ambiance but a bit small.

cafes.name: Wormhole
cafes.comments: Cute ambiance with a Nintendo that actually works properly and the best games (including FF1!). I don't actually remember what the coffee tastes like.

cafes.name: Kopi Travelers Cafe
cafes.comments: Really great ambiance, with pillows and a shop for travelers, including all sorts of guidebooks and bangles. They also have beer and mixed drinks. Haven't gone here to work yet.

cafes.name: La Colombe
cafes.comments: This place gets packed. It's an alright location to do some work.
